text: Implement a queue data structure using two stacks in Python.

generation:
A queue data structure can be implemented in Python using two stacks. The first stack, known as the enqueue stack, is used to add elements to the queue, while the second stack, known as the dequeue stack, is used to remove elements from the queue. To enqueue an element, the element is pushed onto the enqueue stack. To dequeue an element, the element is popped from the dequeue stack. When the enqueue stack is empty, all elements in the dequeue stack are popped, and then the enqueue stack is flipped and becomes the dequeue stack. The dequeue stack is then emptied and becomes the enqueue stack. This flip-flop of the two stacks ensures that enqueue and dequeue operations are carried out in a FIFO (first in, first out) order.
